messages.message: <!here> if we have any security-minded folks, mind reviewing this proposal for Instabase on Microsoft Azure Cloud? I will love to hear your thoughts on where we have left gaps in the security model described in the following document. The only two exceptions in this model are (1) client-side encryption for File System and Databases, (2) key management for encryption at rest for FS and DB. We are planning to incorporate these two in the near future. https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KC6f09bHlSr1HrRCuglaLwvbIGdudykkZVVdJKoIl5A/edit#

took a look but not sure how much value I can add here — if it’s end-to-end encrypted and network isolated then seems reasonable?

I might need an article or two to help give me a framework with which to analyze your proposal here. Not sure if there’s much that jumps out at me
Sounds good, David. Happy to provide more insights as needed

My overall plan/hope is that this security model will lend itself well on the other cloud providers as well as on bare metal. As a result, we will be able to institute security across the board on all infrastructure providers (GCloud, AWS, Azure, Bare Metal data centers).
this looks great @Ashish! Have responded over your email thread
